data.name: 011_Option1
data.value: My choices are my own.

data.name: 010_Option_1
data.value: Well, take care.

data.name: 010_Option_0
data.value: Dust and Jin.

data.name: 013_Option_0
data.value: He still is.

data.name: 013_Option_1
data.value: He's gone now, Ginger.
Aaah! What ARE these things!?
Monsters! Ginger, get down!
If the only way to stop this war is to stop General Gaius, then I need to know where to find him.
His campaign continues to the north. If you want to help right the wrongs of your kind, you're free to join me. I'm afraid-
WHOA! What was that!?
It came from the center of the village!
Mayor Bram mentioned you were leaving town.
Why would the rivers all be drying up? It's not like it's been very hot. And wasn't there a big rain storm a little while ago?
Yes, the rivers and streams around Aurora are beginning to dry up completely. Without water, the only thing to do is head north. It's only a matter of time before the others follow me.
I know, it doesn't make any sense. To be honest, I think this whole country is cursed. General Gaius' bloodlust had scorched this land forever. I doubt we'll ever recover.
If only one man could stand against an army. Sadly no, there is nothing any of us can do. Any hope for the Moonbloods died with my family.
I've tried to help where I can, but it's hard. There aren't many Moonbloods left outside of their homeland, and it's only a matter of time before Gaius wipes them out entirely.
Is there anything I can do to help?
Why is Gaius so obsessed with killing these Moonbloods? What did they do?
Nothing. They... exist. General Gaius sees them as an impurity, a kind of cosmic mistake that he believes must be wiped from this world.
Fidget, please, calm down. She's right to be suspicious - I don't know who I am, but I'm dressed as one of Gaius' soldiers, and that can't be good.
Perhaps. But your friend is right. You've saved my village twice today. Gaius and his soldiers would never do that. Especially if they knew I was here.
That is not an answer!

Hey, ease off! Dust can't remember, okay? He doesn't even know his real name! You know, you should be more thankful - he just saved this village twice, and I- well, I watched him do it, and I'm also really hungry!
And why is that? The last time I saw an outfit like yours was the day my family was murdered. That outfit, it belongs to Gaius' soldiers. Who are you, really?
I... don't know.

He was there the day my family was killed, yes. He was picking up supplies to bring back to his people. General Gaius attacked our village, burned it to the ground. I thought Fuse had been killed. Now I wish he had.
This war is turning all of us into monsters. Thank you, then... For releasing Fuse from his madness.
I'm sorry.
What!? No! Never! Why did you kill him?
Right before the end, he seemed lucid. He told me a few things before he passed. He tried to tell me about the war, about your family-
Fuse? Oh no... He was leading those monsters? You killed him!?
He destroyed Denham Village, Ginger. Slaughtered dozens of innocent people. He refused to listen to reason and planned to attack Aurora next. I had to stop him.
Oh, you again. Mayor Bram said you'd left already.
So you know him, then? Was he always a homicidal pyromaniac?
Yes, he asked us to stop the leader of these monsters. Turns out it was a Moonblood named Fuse. He'd gone completely insane.
You look sad. Is there anything we can do to help?
Please, you two, don't worry about me.
Are you okay?
Please don't take this the wrong way, but I'm not really in a talkative mood.
Dust? Really?
Is something wrong?
I didn't introduce myself before. My name is Dust, and my companion here is Fidget.
Hello again.
Well, that was a noble thing to do. So thank you.
No, I'm sorry. It's just an interesting name. I'm Ginger. Oh, and about those people you saved...
Yes?
And there's nothing we can do about it. Excuse me.
Ah...
Hi there!
You're a quiet one.
Ah, yes. Well... good!
Well, hello.
Dust, manners! You'll have to excuse him, he's a bit worn out. Saving the village and everything, you know?
Honestly, it doesn't matter. They'll just keep coming back.
Yes, I heard something about that.
Dust, that explosion came from below! Hurry!
Alright. You shouldn't stay here, Ginger - it's too dangerous. Head north, we'll catch up with you after we've gotten to the bottom of this.
That's the last of them. Ginger, are you okay?
Stay safe, Dust. We'll meet again at Roan Pass, at the foot of the Blackmoor Mountains.
I'm... I'll be fine. You should go down below and find out what's happening.
Be careful.
Me, too, Ginger. I'll be back before you know it.
I know. Still, I'm glad we were able to talk, Dust.
Maybe... someday. For now, I need him to defeat Gaius. There's no other way.
Perhaps someday you can be rid of his foul presence.
I won't lie, I've felt him pulling me to take the quick and easy path, to leave the weak to fend for themselves, to show no mercy to those in my way.
As long as Cassius lives within you, though... there's always that danger. You could always be pulled to a path of evil.
I feel his presence every time I swing the Blade of Ahrah. I believe the Elder was right - without him, I'd have been cut down long ago, but Jin... Jin keeps him from taking control.
But what of your other half? Cassius murdered my family, Dust. He destroyed my village, killed my friends. How can you control such a terrible being?
No, Ginger, I think you were right the first time. I think Jin continues to live through my actions. He's guiding me, keeping me on the right path.
I suppose I do. Well, I should probably get going.
No, you're right. I need to accept that Jin made his own choice, and it's led to this. To you.
I understand. Good luck, Dust. Stay safe out there.
It sounds like you still have a lot of questions about who you are.
Ginger, you really need to let him go. I wish I could replace him, I do, but...
I just wish I could remember more. Sometimes I wonder if my thoughts are Jin's... or from Cassius... or if I truly am thinking for myself.
You do have his eyes. His face. It's so... strange. You could really be him.
I'm sorry, Dust, I didn't mean to suggest-.
No, I'm sorry. I can't imagine the grief you went through in Zeplich... thinking I might have been your brother.
Like the Elder said, I may share your brother's soul, but the choices I make are mine alone.
He was very kind. Almost to a fault, really.
What was he like?
Yes?
Listen, about Jin...
Yes, he had that effect on people. I like to believe it's what made you do all those wonderful things for Aurora and Mudpot.
I like him already.
Yes... you, too.
I'm sorry, there's still so much to do. You take care.
Of course. Goodbye for now.
No, you're right. We all choose our own paths. Jin chose his, and looking at you now, looking at the things you've done, I think he made the right choice.
I'm sorry things had to turn out this way.
I'm glad we had this talk, Dust. It makes me feel a lot better, knowing that my brother is helping to save this world. Come back soon?
I think he did, too, Ginger.
Yes, Dust - your actions make you who you are.
I suppose I could be. I may not have his memories, but if his soul is guiding me to act as he would, maybe there isn't a difference.
I'd like to think so, Dust. It gives me hope that he didn't die in vain.
Then perhaps your brother lives on through mine.
I'll be fine. Just a lot to think about.
Jin? Oh... Dust. It's you.
Yeah, just me. Are you alright?
Ginger?
And you listened to Jin.

Ahrah was always testing me. Every time I made a choice, he would tell me if it was the right one. I was choosing whether to follow Jin or Cassius. I believe they were both trying to influence my actions.
He is, isn't he?
Yeah... he's kind of hard to ignore.
Or... at least he was.
Are you alright?
Hello again, Dust.
Me, too, Dust. Come back soon?
It's okay, Dust. I know you aren't. But knowing that a piece of him is guiding you to help so many people... it makes me happy. I think it'd make mom and dad happy, too.
I'm glad we were able to talk, Ginger.
I'm sorry, Ginger. But I'm not.
Of course. Goodbye for now.
Yes?

data.name: 014_Option_1
data.value: Impossible.

data.name: 014_Option_0
data.value: Perhaps.

data.name: 011_Option_0
data.value: I'm sure Jin had a hand in it.

data.name: 004_Option_2
data.value: Where can I find General Gaius?

data.name: 004_Option_0
data.value: Tell me about the war.

data.name: 004_Option_1
data.value: Why are you leaving town?
